decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: A101; P001 Rev A; P002 Rev C; Reasonable Exception Statement 9 Anglesmede Crescent 
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 5 - The applicant will ensure that they or their agents take appropriate measures to prevent dust created or released as a result of the works will not impact on the Site of Importance for Nature Conservation and its wildlife.
REASON: For the protection and enhancement of biodiversity in accordance with the national planning policy framework and local plan policies (DM20 and DM21).

Condition : 6 - No building materials or waste are to be stored within 5 metres of the Pinner New Cemetery Footpath Site of Importance for Nature Conservation.
REASON: For the protection and enhancement of biodiversity in accordance with the national planning policy framework and local plan policies (DM20 and DM21).

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, the development hereby approved, prior to the occupation of the new extension shall include the following works: 

a. Install, and permanently maintain, two `swift brick` nesting boxes within the fabric of the new upper storey side wall at or above roof eaves level on the eastern aspect of the building. 

b. Either
After the removal of soot and other loose materials from its interior, reducing and capping off the chimney on the eastern aspect of the building in accordance with the otherwise approved plans, the applicant shall provide the means for bats of small to medium size to access the chimney cavity for the purposes of winter hibernation. A suitable weather shielded entrance, of appropriate dimensions should be provided on the eastern face of the chimney at 0.1-0.5 metres below the level of the existing window ledge;
or
Install within the fabric of the southern elevation of the rear dormer as a summer bat roost feature, two Schwegler 2FR bat tubes (or similarly durable functional equivalent), side by side such that bats might move freely between them. 

c. Prior to first occupation of the newly created living spaced, provide to the Council, photographs of the completed works required by (a) and (b) above.

REASON: For the protection and enhancement of biodiversity in accordance with the national planning policy framework and local plan policies (DM20 and DM21)
description: Alterations to roof to form end gable, rear dormer with Juliette balcony and insertion of two rooflights in front roofslope
